articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korean authorities investigating impeached President Yoon Seok Yeol were at his official residence on Wednesday to execute an arrest warrant over insurrection accusations related to his Dec. 3 martial law declaration.
articles.title: South Korea authorities at President Yoon's residence to execute arrest warrant

articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Negotiators were near to hammering out the final details of a ceasefire in Gaza on Wednesday after marathon talks in Qatar, and the U.S. and Egyptian leaders promised to stay in close contact about a deal over the coming hours.
articles.title: Gaza ceasefire appears close as US, Egyptian leaders put focus on 'coming hours'

articles.author: Jack Kim
articles.description: Yoon has been dogged by personal scandals, an unyielding opposition and rifts within his own party.
articles.title: South Korea's Yoon: Embittered survivor becomes first sitting president arrested

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward, Sarah N. Lynch
articles.description: U.S. Special Counsel Jack Smith concluded that Donald Trump engaged in an "unprecedented criminal effort" to hold on to power after losing the 2020 election, but was thwarted in bringing the case to trial by the president-elect's November election victory, according to a report published on Tuesday.
articles.title: Special counsel report found Trump engaged in ‘criminal effort’ to overturn 2020 election

articles.author: Rami Amichay
articles.description: The ceasefire deal that is close to being agreed in Gaza has left families of the 98 hostages still held in the enclave facing a mix of hope, apprehension, and, in some cases, anger as negotiators make a final push to seal an agreement.
articles.title: Israeli hostage families caught between hope and despair

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan will step up the surveillance and management of ships carrying flags of convenience, including boarding them, after a Chinese-linked cargo vessel was suspected of damaging an undersea communications cable, the government said.
articles.title: After cable damage, Taiwan to step up surveillance of flag of convenience ships

articles.author: Chad Terhune, Jorge Garcia
articles.description: Los Angeles firefighters on Tuesday braced for the return of dry, intense winds that could recharge two monstrous wildfires that have already killed at least 24 people, leveled entire neighborhoods and scorched an area the size of Washington, D.C.
articles.title: LA fires: Santa Ana hurricane-force winds could intensify wildfires

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, John Geddie
articles.description: There is mounting evidence from the battlefield, intelligence reports and testimonies of defectors that some North Korean soldiers are resorting to extreme measures as they support Russia's three-year war with Ukraine.
articles.title: North Korea's suicide soldiers pose new challenge for Ukraine in war with Russia

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Dave Sherwood
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will relax sanctions targeting long-time foe Cuba days before Donald Trump takes office in a broad set of steps on Tuesday that he expects to lead to release of political prisoners in Havana.
articles.title: Biden to significantly relax Cuba sanctions in final days before Trump

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill, Catarina Demony
articles.description: The British minister responsible for financial services and fighting corruption resigned on Tuesday after weeks of questions over her financial ties to her aunt Sheikh Hasina, ousted last year as prime minister of Bangladesh.
articles.title: UK anti-corruption minister resigns over ties to ousted Bangladesh PM
